text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Abelson & Sussman, SICP

text: Program is like a publication, read by people, and probably you.
author: Rob Pike

text: A problem well stated is a problem half-solved.
author: Charles Kettering

text: To attain knowledge, add things everyday; to obtain wisdom, remove things everyday.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Think forwards and backwards — Invert, always invert.
author: Charlie Munger

text: Done is the engine of more.
author: The Cult of Done Manifesto

text: Go that way, really fast. If something gets in your way … turn.
author: 'Better Off Dead' (movie)

text: In a year from now, you'll wish you started today.
author: Karen Lamb

text: We can't solve problems by using the same kind of thinking we used when we created them.
author: Albert Einstein
